content.description: Thin crack 4 feet right of Mousecrack route on Mousehole Buttress -  East of the Quarry rocks.  Share the same fine finish as Mousecrack or climb overhang above middle ledge and wander right around corner to finish upper section of Mousehole route.
content.protection: No problem.  Many sizes and types.  No real run outs.
content.location: Mousehole Buttress -  East of the Quarry Rocks.  It's remote for Devil's Lake.

content.description: Best line on the wall. Climb a nice crack system with plenty of jugs.
content.location: East end of Mousehole Buttress. Walk in to a small corridor and follow the crack to a ledge then to the top anyway you like.

content.description: Climb crack or just right of crack, 12 feet left of West Pillar (routes 7) Route 8 p.45 3rd edition
content.protection: TR, Hand to fist size gear
content.location: The furthest W climb on Mousehole Buttress

content.description:
Worth doing? to get on the upper face.  "Tom" and "Jerry" provide better starts, I think.  No stars for this start, unless you are a true mountaineer, but three stars for the finish. 

  Grovel up the big holds and the crack, crawl through a shrub.  On the clean face above the ledge is a gorgeous, thin crack.  You can access it from the left across blocks, or from directly below.
content.protection: One or two ~ 1/4 inch wired nuts for the crux.
content.location: In between "East Pillar" and "Mousehole" is a face with a huge ledge halfway up.  The lower wall is kinda scrappy, but the upper wall is gorgeous.  "Mouse Crack" starts on the left, on big holds to the right of a wide crack.

content.description: #2 in Sven's. Climb corner to bench. Continue in wide crack, finish on upper corner on top.
content.location: Start in crack system in lower section to the left of the cave to "Mouse Hole".

pathTokens: East Bluff 02 - East of the Quarry

content.description: A uniquely shaped formation, low on the bluff.  Facing the road are two pillars, and on the right side is the mousehole.Routes here are all less than vertical, and of modest difficulty.  But there is some pretty rock and these are worth doing if you are exploring the area.
